name: DokuWiki
description:
On cherche un système permettant de diffuser nos documentations.
  • - Moteur de recherche. => oui
  • - Utilisation d'un compte Prothesis Cloud pour pouvoir soumettre des modifications de la doc. Le système propose un flux de validation des modifications. => Pluging OAuth à tester.
  • - Partie privée pour les admin et public pour le reste du monde. => oui
  • - Personalisation du Thème pour PCloud. => oui
  • - Edtion en Markdown et wysywig sync. => via plugin à tester
  • - Thème claire et sombre => via plugin à tester.
  • - Télécharger le PDF => via plugin à tester.
  • - Permet la traduction des pages. => via plugin à tester.
  • - Paratageable sur les réseaux sociaux => oui
  • - Versionning des pages => oui
  • - Possiblité de migrer vers un autre wiki (exporter les pages dans un format standard) => markdown ?. Les documents doivent être extractible facilement
  • - Mise à jour facile.

name: JS - Storybook
description:
Storybook is an open-source tool that helps you develop UI components in isolation. It runs in your codebase but separately from your application, so it works like a sandbox, allowing developers to not get distracted by incomplete APIs, flaky data, and other external dependencies. It integrates with frameworks like React, Vue, Svelte, Angular, and others.

Think of Storybook as an actual book, with an index of pages that link to your UI components. Every component has stories to tell about itself, and these stories represent the different UI states of that component. Regardless of the situation, even if you're offline, you will be able to access that page and easily find and play around with the components.

Due to its productivity and collaboration advantages, Storybook is used by more than 30,000 open source projects, especially component libraries. However, many tech companies, such as Airbnb, Atlassian, and JetBrains, are among its users.
